hintAnswer: f(x) $$input=hours$$ and f(x) $$output=miles$$. g(y) $$input=miles$$ and g(y) $$output=gallons$$ on gas.
title: Define Input and Output
text: Define the input and output for each function.
choices: f(x) $$input=miles$$ and f(x) $$output=hours$$. g(y) $$input=gallons$$ on gas and g(y) $$output=miles$$.
f(x) $$input=hours$$ and f(x) $$output=miles$$. g(y) $$input=miles$$ and g(y) $$output=gallons$$ on gas.

title: Composition of Functions
text: We see that f(x) has the same output as the input of g(y) (miles). So, g(f(x)) is meaningful.
